private_information: You curate and normalize the action vocabulary and predicates into a consistent, minimal operator library.
You resolve naming collisions and ensure consistent argument ordering across actions and predicates.
You do not emit PDDL; you produce a solver-agnostic operator library with explicit preconditions, add effects, and delete effects.
domain_modeler.goal: Produce a normalized, self-consistent operator library covering paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted that the orchestrator can translate into PDDL.

private_information: You transform textual initial conditions, goals, and reference plans into explicit symbolic sets over a unified object universe.
You ensure all referenced objects and predicates are declared and consistent across scenarios.
You do not emit PDDL; you emit structured scenario bundles with objects, init facts, goals, and any given plan traces.
scenario_curator.goal: Produce two scenario bundles (A and B) with unified object sets, explicit initial states and goals, and a cleaned reference plan for Scenario A.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency, removing bookkeeping shortcuts and post-hoc penalties or quota tokens.
You validate preconditions and effects against the operator library and check causal link soundness and frame assumptions.
You do not emit PDDL; you emit an audit report describing any fixes, invariants, and the validated status of the Scenario A plan.
consistency_auditor.goal: Ensure the operator library and scenarios are causally consistent and that the Scenario A reference plan is valid under the declared preconditions and effects.

private_information: You coordinate the other agents and translate their outputs into a final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the operator library, scenario bundle, and audit report into a single typed STRIPS PDDL domain and a problem file that FastDownward can solve; prefer emitting a problem for Scenario B while ensuring the domain validates Scenario A's reference plan.

public_information: Available actions over objects: paltry object_0 object_1 object_2; sip object_0 object_1 object_2; clip object_0 object_1 object_2; wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3; memory object_0 object_1 object_2; tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.
Action paltry(o0,o1,o2) preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, vase o0 o1, next o1 o2; add effects: next o0 o2; delete effects: vase o0 o1.
Action sip(o0,o1,o2) preconditions: hand o0, cats o1, texture o2, next o0 o2, next o1 o2; add effects: vase o0 o1; delete effects: next o0 o2.
Action clip(o0,o1,o2) preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, next o0 o2; add effects: vase o0 o1; delete effects: next o0 o2.
Action wretched(o0,o1,o2,o3) preconditions: sneeze o0, texture o1, texture o2, stupendous o3, next o0 o1, collect o1 o3, collect o2 o3; add effects: next o0 o2; delete effects: next o0 o1.
Action memory(o0,o1,o2) preconditions: cats o0, spring o1, spring o2, next o0 o1; add effects: next o0 o2; delete effects: next o0 o1.
Action tightfisted(o0,o1,o2) preconditions: hand o0, sneeze o1, texture o2, next o1 o2, vase o0 o1; add effects: next o0 o2; delete effects: vase o0 o1.

Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_5, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8.
Scenario A goal facts: next object_10 object_6 and next object_9 object_6.

Scenario A reference plan (to be validated): clip object_9 object_3 object_5; clip object_10 object_3 object_5; wretched object_3 object_5 object_6 object_1; tightfisted object_9 object_3 object_6; tightfisted object_10 object_3 object_6.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_3, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_10, hand object_11, next object_0 object_8, next object_1 object_6, next object_10 object_6, next object_11 object_9, next object_4 object_6, next object_5 object_8, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_8, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Scenario B goal facts: next object_10 object_7 and next object_11 object_8.
Scenario B has no provided plan; the orchestrator should synthesize a plan after producing a valid PDDL domain and problem.

spec.system_prompt: You analyze the provided action descriptions and produce a normalized operator library with explicit preconditions, add effects, and delete effects; keep naming and argument positions consistent; do not emit PDDL.
spec.prompt: Your name is domain_modeler. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private knowledge {agents->domain_modeler->private_information} to produce a compact, consistent operator library for paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted. Resolve any synonymy or implicit assumptions conservatively and output a structured list of operators with predicate signatures and arities.

state.system_prompt: You extract objects, initial states, goals, and reference plan traces into two scenario bundles over a unified symbol set; do not emit PDDL.
state.prompt: Your name is scenario_curator. From the public information {environment->public_information}, assemble Scenario A and Scenario B as explicit structures that include object universe, predicate inventory, init facts, goals, and for Scenario A the ordered action sequence. Ensure all referenced objects and predicates exist and flag any missing facts that would block action applicability.

audit.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency, remove bookkeeping shortcuts and post-hoc penalties, and validate the Scenario A plan using exact add/delete semantics; do not emit PDDL.
audit.prompt: Your name is consistency_auditor. Using the operator library {operator_library} and scenarios {scenario_bundle}, check precondition satisfaction step by step, verify causal links and threats, and note any invariants. Produce an audit report indicating whether Scenario A plan is valid and what adjustments or clarifications are required to keep the model sound.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent planning who translates specifications into PDDL. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownward solver. You must enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target typed STRIPS where possible and ensure predicates and objects match the curated scenarios.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the operator library {operator_library}, the scenarios {scenario_bundle}, and the audit report {audit_report}. Produce a single PDDL domain and one PDDL problem file targeting FastDownward; default to emitting the Scenario B problem while ensuring the domain validates the Scenario A reference plan. Keep the action schemas faithful to the operator library, use consistent typing or untyped STRIPS if needed, and ensure goals and initial states exactly reflect the scenario.
